titleStmt.title: A fruteful treatise of predestination, and of the deuyne prouidence of god as far forth as the holy scriptures and word of god shal lead vs, and an answer made to all the vain and blasphemous obiections that the epicures and Anabaptistes of our time canne make. Set forth dialoge wise, by Ihon Veron.
Fruteful treatise of predestination, and of the devyne providence of god.
titleStmt.author: Véron, John, d. 1563.

titleStmt.title: A fruteful treatise of predestination, and of the deuyne prouidence of god as far forth as the holy scriptures and word of god shal lead vs, and an answer made to all the vain and blasphemous obiections that the epicures and Anabaptistes of our time canne make. Set forth dialoge wise, by Ihon Veron.
Fruteful treatise of predestination, and of the devyne providence of god.
titleStmt.author: Véron, John, d. 1563.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Ihon Tisdale dwelling in knighte Riders streate, neare to the Quenes Wardroppe,

notesStmt.note: Printer's name and address from colophon; publication date from STC.
Variant: with *⁴ containing "To the readers" and "Argument", more often found with STC 24681.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
Beginning-C4 from the Bodleian Library copy spliced at end.
